The urea cycle is a metabolic pathway that converts toxic ammonia into urea, which can be safely excreted by the body. NH3 + HCO3- + 2 ATP --> carbamoyl phosph: This is the first step of the urea cycle, where ammonia is combined with bicarbonate and ATP to form carbamoyl phosphate.
Carbamoyl phosphate + ornithine --> citr: This is the second step of the urea cycle, where citrulline is formed from carbamoyl phosphate and ornithine.
Citrulline + aspartate + ATP --> arginos: This is the third step of the urea cycle, where arginosuccinate is formed from citrulline, aspartate, and ATP.
Arginine + H20 --> ornithine + urea: This is the final step of the urea cycle, where arginine is broken down into ornithine and urea, which can be excreted by the body.
